00043 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FID
00044 
00045 #include <linux/module.h>
00046 #include <libcfs/libcfs.h>
00047 #include <obd.h>
00048 #include <obd_class.h>
00049 #include <obd_support.h>
00050 #include <lustre_fid.h>
00051 /* mdc RPC locks */
00052 #include <lustre_mdc.h>
00053 #include "fid_internal.h"
00054 
00055 static int seq_client_rpc(struct lu_client_seq *seq,
00056                           struct lu_seq_range *output, __u32 opc,
00057                           const char *opcname)
00058 {
00059         struct obd_export     *exp = seq->lcs_exp;
00060         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00061         struct lu_seq_range   *out, *in;
00062         __u32                 *op;
00063         unsigned int           debug_mask;
00064         int                    rc;
00065         ENTRY;
00066 
00067         LASSERT(exp != NULL && !IS_ERR(exp));
00068         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc_pack(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_SEQ_QUERY,
00069                                         LUSTRE_MDS_VERSION, SEQ_QUERY);
00070         if (req == NULL)
00071                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00072 
00073         /* Init operation code */
00074         op = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SEQ_OPC);
00075         *op = opc;
00076 
00077         /* Zero out input range, this is not recovery yet. */
00078         in = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SEQ_RANGE);
00079         lu_seq_range_init(in);
00080 
00081         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00082 
00083         in->lsr_index = seq->lcs_space.lsr_index;
00084         if (seq->lcs_type == LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA)
00085                 fld_range_set_mdt(in);
00086         else
00087                 fld_range_set_ost(in);
00088 
00089         if (opc == SEQ_ALLOC_SUPER) {
00090                 req->rq_request_portal = SEQ_CONTROLLER_PORTAL;
00091                 req->rq_reply_portal = MDC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00092                 /* During allocating super sequence for data object,
00093                  * the current thread might hold the export of MDT0(MDT0
00094                  * precreating objects on this OST), and it will send the
00095                  * request to MDT0 here, so we can not keep resending the
00096                  * request here, otherwise if MDT0 is failed(umounted),
00097                  * it can not release the export of MDT0 */
00098                 if (seq->lcs_type == LUSTRE_SEQ_DATA)
00099                         req->rq_no_delay = req->rq_no_resend = 1;
00100                 debug_mask = D_CONSOLE;
00101         } else {
00102                 if (seq->lcs_type == LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA) {
00103                         req->rq_reply_portal = MDC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00104                         req->rq_request_portal = SEQ_METADATA_PORTAL;
00105                 } else {
00106                         req->rq_reply_portal = OSC_REPLY_PORTAL;
00107                         req->rq_request_portal = SEQ_DATA_PORTAL;
00108                 }
00109 
00110                 debug_mask = D_INFO;
00111         }
00112 
00113         /* Allow seq client RPC during recovery time. */
00114         req->rq_allow_replay = 1;
00115 
00116         ptlrpc_at_set_req_timeout(req);
00117 
00118         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
00119 
00120         if (rc)
00121                 GOTO(out_req, rc);
00122 
00123         out = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_SEQ_RANGE);
00124         *output = *out;
00125 
00126         if (!lu_seq_range_is_sane(output)) {
00127                 CERROR("%s: Invalid range received from server: "
00128                        DRANGE"\n", seq->lcs_name, PRANGE(output));
00129                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EINVAL);
00130         }
00131 
00132         if (lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(output)) {
00133                 CERROR("%s: Range received from server is exhausted: "
00134                        DRANGE"]\n", seq->lcs_name, PRANGE(output));
00135                 GOTO(out_req, rc = -EINVAL);
00136         }
00137 
00138         CDEBUG_LIMIT(debug_mask, "%s: Allocated %s-sequence "DRANGE"]\n",
00139                      seq->lcs_name, opcname, PRANGE(output));
00140 
00141         EXIT;
00142 out_req:
00143         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00144         return rc;
00145 }
00146 
00147 /* Request sequence-controller node to allocate new super-sequence. */
00148 int seq_client_alloc_super(struct lu_client_seq *seq,
00149                            const struct lu_env *env)
00150 {
00151         int rc;
00152         ENTRY;
00153 
00154         mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00155 
00156         if (seq->lcs_srv) {
00157 #ifdef HAVE_SEQ_SERVER
00158                 LASSERT(env != NULL);
00159                 rc = seq_server_alloc_super(seq->lcs_srv, &seq->lcs_space,
00160                                             env);
00161 #else
00162                 rc = 0;
00163 #endif
00164         } else {
00165                 /* Check whether the connection to seq controller has been
00166                  * setup (lcs_exp != NULL) */
00167                 if (seq->lcs_exp == NULL) {
00168                         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00169                         RETURN(-EINPROGRESS);
00170                 }
00171 
00172                 rc = seq_client_rpc(seq, &seq->lcs_space,
00173                                     SEQ_ALLOC_SUPER, "super");
00174         }
00175         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00176         RETURN(rc);
00177 }
00178 
00179 /* Request sequence-controller node to allocate new meta-sequence. */
00180 static int seq_client_alloc_meta(const struct lu_env *env,
00181                                  struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00182 {
00183         int rc;
00184         ENTRY;
00185 
00186         if (seq->lcs_srv) {
00187 #ifdef HAVE_SEQ_SERVER
00188                 LASSERT(env != NULL);
00189                 rc = seq_server_alloc_meta(seq->lcs_srv, &seq->lcs_space, env);
00190 #else
00191                 rc = 0;
00192 #endif
00193         } else {
00194                 do {
00195                         /* If meta server return -EINPROGRESS or EAGAIN,
00196                          * it means meta server might not be ready to
00197                          * allocate super sequence from sequence controller
00198                          * (MDT0)yet */
00199                         rc = seq_client_rpc(seq, &seq->lcs_space,
00200                                             SEQ_ALLOC_META, "meta");
00201                 } while (rc == -EINPROGRESS || rc == -EAGAIN);
00202         }
00203 
00204         RETURN(rc);
00205 }
00206 
00207 /* Allocate new sequence for client. */
00208 static int seq_client_alloc_seq(const struct lu_env *env,
00209                                 struct lu_client_seq *seq, u64 *seqnr)
00210 {
00211         int rc;
00212         ENTRY;
00213 
00214         LASSERT(lu_seq_range_is_sane(&seq->lcs_space));
00215 
00216         if (lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(&seq->lcs_space)) {
00217                 rc = seq_client_alloc_meta(env, seq);
00218                 if (rc) {
00219                         CERROR("%s: Can't allocate new meta-sequence,"
00220                                "rc %d\n", seq->lcs_name, rc);
00221                         RETURN(rc);
00222                 } else {
00223                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: New range - "DRANGE"\n",
00224                                seq->lcs_name, PRANGE(&seq->lcs_space));
00225                 }
00226         } else {
00227                 rc = 0;
00228         }
00229 
00230         LASSERT(!lu_seq_range_is_exhausted(&seq->lcs_space));
00231         *seqnr = seq->lcs_space.lsr_start;
00232         seq->lcs_space.lsr_start += 1;
00233 
00234         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Allocated sequence ["LPX64"]\n", seq->lcs_name,
00235                *seqnr);
00236 
00237         RETURN(rc);
00238 }
00239 
00240 static int seq_fid_alloc_prep(struct lu_client_seq *seq,
00241                               wait_queue_t *link)
00242 {
00243         if (seq->lcs_update) {
00244                 add_wait_queue(&seq->lcs_waitq, link);
00245                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00246                 mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00247 
00248                 schedule();
00249 
00250                 mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00251                 remove_wait_queue(&seq->lcs_waitq, link);
00252                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00253                 return -EAGAIN;
00254         }
00255         ++seq->lcs_update;
00256         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00257         return 0;
00258 }
00259 
00260 static void seq_fid_alloc_fini(struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00261 {
00262         LASSERT(seq->lcs_update == 1);
00263         mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00264         --seq->lcs_update;
00265         wake_up(&seq->lcs_waitq);
00266 }
00267 
00271 int seq_client_get_seq(const struct lu_env *env,
00272                        struct lu_client_seq *seq, u64 *seqnr)
00273 {
00274         wait_queue_t link;
00275         int rc;
00276 
00277         LASSERT(seqnr != NULL);
00278         mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00279         init_waitqueue_entry(&link, current);
00280 
00281         while (1) {
00282                 rc = seq_fid_alloc_prep(seq, &link);
00283                 if (rc == 0)
00284                         break;
00285         }
00286 
00287         rc = seq_client_alloc_seq(env, seq, seqnr);
00288         if (rc) {
00289                 CERROR("%s: Can't allocate new sequence, "
00290                        "rc %d\n", seq->lcs_name, rc);
00291                 seq_fid_alloc_fini(seq);
00292                 mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00293                 return rc;
00294         }
00295 
00296         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: allocate sequence "
00297                "[0x%16.16"LPF64"x]\n", seq->lcs_name, *seqnr);
00298 
00299         /* Since the caller require the whole seq,
00300          * so marked this seq to be used */
00301         if (seq->lcs_type == LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA)
00302                 seq->lcs_fid.f_oid = LUSTRE_METADATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH;
00303         else
00304                 seq->lcs_fid.f_oid = LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH;
00305 
00306         seq->lcs_fid.f_seq = *seqnr;
00307         seq->lcs_fid.f_ver = 0;
00308         /*
00309          * Inform caller that sequence switch is performed to allow it
00310          * to setup FLD for it.
00311          */
00312         seq_fid_alloc_fini(seq);
00313         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00314 
00315         return rc;
00316 }
00317 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_client_get_seq);
00318 
00319 /* Allocate new fid on passed client @seq and save it to @fid. */
00320 int seq_client_alloc_fid(const struct lu_env *env,
00321                          struct lu_client_seq *seq, struct lu_fid *fid)
00322 {
00323         wait_queue_t link;
00324         int rc;
00325         ENTRY;
00326 
00327         LASSERT(seq != NULL);
00328         LASSERT(fid != NULL);
00329 
00330         init_waitqueue_entry(&link, current);
00331         mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00332 
00333         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_SEQ_EXHAUST))
00334                 seq->lcs_fid.f_oid = seq->lcs_width;
00335 
00336         while (1) {
00337                 u64 seqnr;
00338 
00339                 if (!fid_is_zero(&seq->lcs_fid) &&
00340                     fid_oid(&seq->lcs_fid) < seq->lcs_width) {
00341                         /* Just bump last allocated fid and return to caller. */
00342                         seq->lcs_fid.f_oid += 1;
00343                         rc = 0;
00344                         break;
00345                 }
00346 
00347                 rc = seq_fid_alloc_prep(seq, &link);
00348                 if (rc)
00349                         continue;
00350 
00351                 rc = seq_client_alloc_seq(env, seq, &seqnr);
00352                 if (rc) {
00353                         CERROR("%s: Can't allocate new sequence, "
00354                                "rc %d\n", seq->lcs_name, rc);
00355                         seq_fid_alloc_fini(seq);
00356                         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00357                         RETURN(rc);
00358                 }
00359 
00360                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Switch to sequence "
00361                        "[0x%16.16"LPF64"x]\n", seq->lcs_name, seqnr);
00362 
00363                 seq->lcs_fid.f_oid = LUSTRE_FID_INIT_OID;
00364                 seq->lcs_fid.f_seq = seqnr;
00365                 seq->lcs_fid.f_ver = 0;
00366 
00367                 /*
00368                  * Inform caller that sequence switch is performed to allow it
00369                  * to setup FLD for it.
00370                  */
00371                 rc = 1;
00372 
00373                 seq_fid_alloc_fini(seq);
00374                 break;
00375         }
00376 
00377         *fid = seq->lcs_fid;
00378         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00379 
00380         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: Allocated FID "DFID"\n", seq->lcs_name,  PFID(fid));
00381         RETURN(rc);
00382 }
00383 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_client_alloc_fid);
00384 
00385 /*
00386  * Finish the current sequence due to disconnect.
00387  * See mdc_import_event()
00388  */
00389 void seq_client_flush(struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00390 {
00391         wait_queue_t link;
00392 
00393         LASSERT(seq != NULL);
00394         init_waitqueue_entry(&link, current);
00395         mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00396 
00397         while (seq->lcs_update) {
00398                 add_wait_queue(&seq->lcs_waitq, &link);
00399                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00400                 mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00401 
00402                 schedule();
00403 
00404                 mutex_lock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00405                 remove_wait_queue(&seq->lcs_waitq, &link);
00406                 set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00407         }
00408 
00409         fid_zero(&seq->lcs_fid);
00415         seq->lcs_space.lsr_index = -1;
00416 
00417         lu_seq_range_init(&seq->lcs_space);
00418         mutex_unlock(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00419 }
00420 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_client_flush);
00421 
00422 static void seq_client_proc_fini(struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00423 {
00424 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00425         ENTRY;
00426         if (seq->lcs_proc_dir) {
00427                 if (!IS_ERR(seq->lcs_proc_dir))
00428                         lprocfs_remove(&seq->lcs_proc_dir);
00429                 seq->lcs_proc_dir = NULL;
00430         }
00431         EXIT;
00432 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00433 }
00434 
00435 static int seq_client_proc_init(struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00436 {
00437 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00438         int rc;
00439         ENTRY;
00440 
00441         seq->lcs_proc_dir = lprocfs_register(seq->lcs_name, seq_type_proc_dir,
00442                                              NULL, NULL);
00443         if (IS_ERR(seq->lcs_proc_dir)) {
00444                 CERROR("%s: LProcFS failed in seq-init\n",
00445                        seq->lcs_name);
00446                 rc = PTR_ERR(seq->lcs_proc_dir);
00447                 RETURN(rc);
00448         }
00449 
00450         rc = lprocfs_add_vars(seq->lcs_proc_dir, seq_client_proc_list, seq);
00451         if (rc) {
00452                 CERROR("%s: Can't init sequence manager "
00453                        "proc, rc %d\n", seq->lcs_name, rc);
00454                 GOTO(out_cleanup, rc);
00455         }
00456 
00457         RETURN(0);
00458 
00459 out_cleanup:
00460         seq_client_proc_fini(seq);
00461         return rc;
00462 
00463 #else /* !CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00464         return 0;
00465 #endif /* CONFIG_PROC_FS */
00466 }
00467 
00468 int seq_client_init(struct lu_client_seq *seq,
00469                     struct obd_export *exp,
00470                     enum lu_cli_type type,
00471                     const char *prefix,
00472                     struct lu_server_seq *srv)
00473 {
00474         int rc;
00475         ENTRY;
00476 
00477         LASSERT(seq != NULL);
00478         LASSERT(prefix != NULL);
00479 
00480         seq->lcs_srv = srv;
00481         seq->lcs_type = type;
00482 
00483         mutex_init(&seq->lcs_mutex);
00484         if (type == LUSTRE_SEQ_METADATA)
00485                 seq->lcs_width = LUSTRE_METADATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH;
00486         else
00487                 seq->lcs_width = LUSTRE_DATA_SEQ_MAX_WIDTH;
00488 
00489         init_waitqueue_head(&seq->lcs_waitq);
00490         /* Make sure that things are clear before work is started. */
00491         seq_client_flush(seq);
00492 
00493         if (exp != NULL)
00494                 seq->lcs_exp = class_export_get(exp);
00495 
00496         snprintf(seq->lcs_name, sizeof(seq->lcs_name),
00497                  "cli-%s", prefix);
00498 
00499         rc = seq_client_proc_init(seq);
00500         if (rc)
00501                 seq_client_fini(seq);
00502         RETURN(rc);
00503 }
00504 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_client_init);
00505 
00506 void seq_client_fini(struct lu_client_seq *seq)
00507 {
00508         ENTRY;
00509 
00510         seq_client_proc_fini(seq);
00511 
00512         if (seq->lcs_exp != NULL) {
00513                 class_export_put(seq->lcs_exp);
00514                 seq->lcs_exp = NULL;
00515         }
00516 
00517         seq->lcs_srv = NULL;
00518         EXIT;
00519 }
00520 EXPORT_SYMBOL(seq_client_fini);
00521 
00522 int client_fid_init(struct obd_device *obd,
00523                     struct obd_export *exp, enum lu_cli_type type)
00524 {
00525         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
00526         char *prefix;
00527         int rc;
00528         ENTRY;
00529 
00530         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(cli->cl_seq);
00531         if (cli->cl_seq == NULL)
00532                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00533 
00534         OBD_ALLOC(prefix, MAX_OBD_NAME + 5);
00535         if (prefix == NULL)
00536                 GOTO(out_free_seq, rc = -ENOMEM);
00537 
00538         snprintf(prefix, MAX_OBD_NAME + 5, "cli-%s", obd->obd_name);
00539 
00540         /* Init client side sequence-manager */
00541         rc = seq_client_init(cli->cl_seq, exp, type, prefix, NULL);
00542         OBD_FREE(prefix, MAX_OBD_NAME + 5);
00543         if (rc)
00544                 GOTO(out_free_seq, rc);
00545 
00546         RETURN(rc);
00547 out_free_seq:
00548         OBD_FREE_PTR(cli->cl_seq);
00549         cli->cl_seq = NULL;
00550         return rc;
00551 }
00552 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_fid_init);
00553 
00554 int client_fid_fini(struct obd_device *obd)
00555 {
00556         struct client_obd *cli = &obd->u.cli;
00557         ENTRY;
00558 
00559         if (cli->cl_seq != NULL) {
00560                 seq_client_fini(cli->cl_seq);
00561                 OBD_FREE_PTR(cli->cl_seq);
00562                 cli->cl_seq = NULL;
00563         }
00564 
00565         RETURN(0);
00566 }
00567 EXPORT_SYMBOL(client_fid_fini);
00568 
00569 struct proc_dir_entry *seq_type_proc_dir;
00570 
00571 static int __init fid_init(void)
00572 {
00573         seq_type_proc_dir = lprocfs_register(LUSTRE_SEQ_NAME,
00574                                              proc_lustre_root,
00575                                              NULL, NULL);
00576         if (IS_ERR(seq_type_proc_dir))
00577                 return PTR_ERR(seq_type_proc_dir);
00578 
00579 # ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00580         fid_server_mod_init();
00581 # endif
00582 
00583         return 0;
00584 }
00585 
00586 static void __exit fid_exit(void)
00587 {
00588 # ifdef HAVE_SERVER_SUPPORT
00589         fid_server_mod_exit();
00590 # endif
00591 
00592         if (seq_type_proc_dir != NULL && !IS_ERR(seq_type_proc_dir)) {
00593                 lprocfs_remove(&seq_type_proc_dir);
00594                 seq_type_proc_dir = NULL;
00595         }
00596 }

00603 module_init(fid_init);
00604 module_exit(fid_exit);
